intro: Senecio quiroranus, commonly known as the Quirora ragwort, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Senecio quiroranus is a perennial species that plays a role in its local ecosystem, though it is not widely cultivated.
